entry.title: Diên Hồng Square (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a memorial bust (pictured) at Diên Hồng Square commemorates a 15-year-old protestor who was shot dead there?

entry.title: Frederick E. Olmsted (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Frederick E. Olmsted was instrumental in the creation of nineteen national forests and the Muir Woods National Monument in California?

entry.title: South Korea has censored military-affiliated golf courses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that South Korea has censored military-affiliated golf courses?

entry.title: Mahathir Mohamad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that as Malaysian prime minister, Mahathir Mohamad called the outcomes of the 1992 Earth Summit "eco-imperialism"?

entry.title: The Day Before the Revolution (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ursula K. Le Guin's short story "The Day Before the Revolution", which won Nebula and Locus Awards in 1975, was praised for its depiction of a "revolutionary icon as a curmudgeonly old woman"?

entry.title: Christian Nodal (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mexican musician Christian Nodal was the first artist to have a regional Mexican song enter the Billboard Hot 100?

entry.title: Angelito de Canal 13 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Angelito de Canal 13, the mascot of the Chilean television network Canal 13, was inspired by its creator's son?

entry.title: Jeff Allen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that football player Jeff Allen had an "ability to scramble through small holes" that earned him the nickname "Rat"?
